特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
Lectures, case discussions, and presentations(and/or short term paper).
Students are also supposed to participate a chanoyu experiential lesson as a field trip.

第1回: course introduction & background of the Japanese idea of omotenashi with the description how Japanese people enjoy at a karaoke party
第2回: meanings of omotenashi in light of chado-1: understanding the spirit of kata and do reflected in Japanese culture
第3回: omotenashi as industry-1: features of customer service and management system in Japanese tourism with a focus on ryokan, or traditional Japanese inn
第4回: omotenashi as industry-2: features of customer service and management system in Japanese tourism with a focus on Japanese hotels
第5回: omotenashi as customer service at the traditional department store
第6回: field trip (chado experience) meanings of omotenashi in light of chado-2: practicing the spirit of kata and do)
第7回: omotenashi as industry-3:marketing strategies of Chado Urasenke
第8回: omotenashi as business practice: kimono retailers and traditional business style
第9回: omotenashi as industry-4: features of customer service and management system in Japanese tourism with a focus on shinkansen
第11回: discusson about the difference between hospitality and omotenashi
トピック.授業計画1: The program will be changed to meet participants' interests.
トピック.授業外学習2:
The student is expected to prepare for classes by completing the reading assignments with strong interest in Japanese idea of omotenashi as well as Japanese culture.
Students will be given a brief experience of making and drinking tea with some explanations of tearoom, flowers, and scroll.
